title.value: ON THE STABILITY OF A NON-HYPERBOLIC NONLINEAR MAP WITH NON-BOUNDED SET OF NON-ISOLATED FIXED POINTS WITH APPLICATIONS TO MACHINE LEARNING
title.justification: The title accurately reflects the main focus of the paper which is on the stability analysis of a specific nonlinear map related to machine learning applications.
title.quote: ON THE STABILITY OF A NON-HYPERBOLIC NONLINEAR MAP WITH NON-BOUNDED SET OF NON-ISOLATED FIXED POINTS WITH APPLICATIONS TO MACHINE LEARNING

extractions.description: This paper presents a convergence analysis of the SUCPA algorithm within the context of dynamical systems. The study focuses on the local and global stability of the nonlinear map derived from the SUCPA algorithm, used for calibrating scores output by machine learning classifiers. The primary goal is to demonstrate the global asymptotic stability of this map, especially for binary classification problems, with numerical experiments supporting the theoretical findings.

type.justification: The paper is primarily concerned with theoretical analysis, as it delves into the convergence properties and stability analysis of a nonlinear map derived from the SUCPA algorithm.
type.quote: The convergence analysis is addressed as a dynamical system problem, by studying the local and global stability of the nonlinear map derived from the algorithm.

primary_research_field.justification: The research focuses on improving machine learning classifiers via the SUCPA algorithm, which is designed to calibrate the classifiers' output scores.
primary_research_field.quote: The SUCPA algorithm was first developed in the context of supervised machine learning classifiers.

sub_research_fields.justification: The paper's main contribution lies in analyzing the convergence and stability of the SUCPA algorithm.
sub_research_fields.quote: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm.

name.justification: The SUCPA algorithm is the primary focus of the paper and is thoroughly analyzed for its convergence properties.
name.quote: This paper deals with the convergence analysis of the SUCPA (Semi Unsupervised Calibration through Prior Adaptation) algorithm.

caracteristics.justification: SUCPA is used to calibrate the output scores of supervised machine learning classifiers.
caracteristics.quote: The SUCPA algorithm was first developed in the context of supervised machine learning classifiers.

name.justification: The SST-2 dataset is used for numerical experiments to demonstrate the efficacy of the SUCPA algorithm in binary sentiment classification tasks.
name.quote: a subset of the SST-2 dataset [28], which contains examples of annotated movie reviews was used.

name.justification: The MNLI dataset is employed to show the behavior of the SUCPA algorithm in a classification task with three classes.
name.quote: We choose the MNLI dataset [33], which contains examples of sentence pairs with textual entailment annotations.

name.justification: The Asirra dataset is utilized for an image classification task to test the SUCPA algorithm on a completely different application than text classification.
name.quote: a recognizer of images of dogs and cats was trained on the Asirra dataset [11] obtained from the Dogs-vs-Cats Kaggle competition website.

name.justification: GPT-2 is used to obtain class scores for text classification tasks.
name.quote: To obtain the class scores, the GPT-2 model [26] was used.

name.justification: ResNet-18 is fine-tuned on the Asirra dataset to perform an image classification task.
name.quote: In this case, the pretrained ResNet-18 [16] model was fine-tuned on 80% of the training data and validated on the rest.
